Name: Hasty
Fate: Torpedoed by the German motor torpedo boat S-55 on 14 June 1942, scuttled the following day.
Displacement:
1,350 long tons (1,370 t) (standard)
1,883 long tons (1,913 t) (deep load)
Propulsion:
2 shafts, Parsons geared steam turbines
3 Admiralty 3-drum water-tube boilers
Range: 5,530 nmi (10,240 km; 6,360 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × single 4.7-inch (120 mm) Mark IX guns
2 × quadruple 12.7mm Vickers machine guns
2 × quadruple 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
2 × depth charge throwers, 1 rail and 20 depth charges
